title: Services Program Manager - Bangalore (On-site)
content:
We're Celonis, the global leader in execution management and process mining technology, and one of the 50 most valuable private companies in the world. We believe that every company can unlock its full execution capacity - and for that, we need you to join us.








 
The Role:
The role of the Celonis Services Program Manager is key to the overall quality, efficiency and capacity of our Celonis Services function. The primary responsibility is to monitor capacity, skills and resource efficiencies for all potential and assigned projects across all Celonis Services resources, providing data drive insights to Celonis Services leaders to make decisions for hiring, planning, training and subcontracting purposes. 
There is also the requirement to report on future demand, skill planning and capacity in general working closely also with Services Leaders and Enablement teams to ensure skills readiness. As the program manager you will liaison with many stakeholders across the organisation including Sales, Operations, Finance, and Enablement teams.
The program manager must also ensure that project resourcing is managed in order to assure timelines and must communicate to appropriate Engagement Managers issues that may impact scheduled deadlines. It is also required that this position enforce company processes by utilising assigned systems and processes.
The work you’ll do:

Act as point of contact for skills requirements, resource allocation, conflict resolution, and reporting to support CS business goals.
Assist with managing and increasing utilisation numbers within the Celonis Services team.
Build, maintain, and communicate skills availability, capacity and resourcing information.
Work alongside Operations and Enablement and input into overall training, hiring recommendations based on resource reviews to ensure the right resources, with the right skill are available.
Manage capacity and skills resourcing forecast tools for Celonis Services based on input from weekly meetings.
Work with Celonis Services Practice Leaders and Engagement Managers weekly to identify appropriate resource requirements for all projects and activities.
Work to resolve any issues regarding under or over allocations of current staff members.
Maintain constant knowledge of current and upcoming projects and business development activities.
Produce quarterly summarised reporting for Senior Management team identifying potential risks or issues.
Be the liaison between the Celonis Services leaders and subcontractors as required. 
Identify potential process issues and present to the Celonis Services Management team with resolutions to such issues where applicable.

The qualifications you need:

Proven consulting and program/project management background and experience in post-sales consulting and/or operational roles.
Passion for using operational metrics and process improvement to support key decisions and drive organisational optimization.
Involved in an organisation during a period of growth and transformation. 
An independent self starter with exceptional communication, presentation, interpersonal and analytical skills. 
Capacity or resource management experience in the software solutions industry.
Salesforce/FinancialForce experience.
Highly detail oriented and able to work autonomously.
Ability to manage multiple tasks and tight deadlines with confidence and ease.
Ability to prioritise and organise workload across multiple stakeholders.
Bachelor's degree required.
What Celonis can offer you:

The unique opportunity to work within a new category of technology, Execution Management
Investment in your personal growth and skill development (clear career paths, internal mobility opportunities, L&D platform, mentorships, and more)
Great compensation and benefits packages (equity (restricted stock units), life insurance, time off, generous leave for new parents from day one, and more). For intern and working student benefits, click here
Physical and mental well-being support (subsidized gym membership, access to counselling, virtual events on well-being topics, and more)
A global and growing team of Celonauts from diverse backgrounds to learn from and work with
An open-minded culture with innovative, autonomous teams
Business Resource Groups to help you feel connected, valued and seen (Black@Celonis, Women@Celonis, Parents@Celonis, Pride@Celonis, Resilience@Celonis, and more)
A clear set of company values that guide everything we do: Live for Customer Value, The Best Team Wins, We Own It, and Earth Is Our Future

About Us
Since 2011, Celonis has helped thousands of the world’s largest and most esteemed companies yield immediate cash impact, radically improve customer experience, and reduce carbon emissions. Its Process Intelligence platform uses industry-leading process mining technology and AI to present companies with a living digital twin of their end-to-end processes. For the first time, everyone in an organization has a common language for how the business runs, visibility into where value is hiding, and the ability to capture it. Celonis is headquartered in Munich, Germany and New York City, USA with more than 20 offices worldwide.
Celonis is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment and equal opportunity in all aspects of employment. We will not tolerate any unlawful discrimination or harassment of any kind. We make all employment decisions without regard to race/ethnicity, color, sex, pregnancy, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, transgender status, national origin, citizenship status, religion, physical or mental disability, veteran status, or any other factor protected by applicable anti-discrimination laws.  As a US federal contractor, we are committed to the principles of affirmative action in accordance with applicable laws and regulations.  Different makes us better.
